meanings.definition: A difference or contrast between similar things or people.
meanings.sent1: There is a clear distinction between the two types of flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The distinction between the two twins is their eye color.
meanings.sent3: The cat made a distinction between the red and blue balls by only playing with the red one.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the distinction between abstract and realistic paintings is often debated.
meanings.sent5: The distinction between right and wrong is an important lesson for children to learn.

meanings.sent1: She received a distinction for her outstanding performance in the play.
meanings.sent2: The distinction given to the top student motivated others to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked in distinction when it saw its owner approaching.
meanings.sent4: His talent in playing the piano set him apart, earning him a distinction among musicians.
meanings.sent5: The distinction awarded to the best athlete was well-deserved.

meanings.sent1: Winning the spelling bee was a great distinction for Sarah.
meanings.sent2: The distinction of being named valedictorian was a proud moment for him.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt a sense of distinction when it received a shiny new collar.
meanings.sent4: The golden trophy symbolized the highest distinction in the competition.
meanings.sent5: Receiving a distinction for bravery in battle is a remarkable achievement.
